description.narrative: The project Promoting Gender Equality through Local Knowledge & People’s Initiative aims to ensure empowerment of deprived people specially women and girls through gender equality. The core problem lies on the lack of holistic awareness among the deprived population especially women, lack of information, not being able to participate in the decision making process, lesser wage/salary than men, lack of economic opportunity, deprived from justice, illiteracy, unequal opportunity, religious superstition, not having the right environment for creative work etc.  To achieve the goal, the partner has been identified four major objectives which are a.   gender equality and human rights, b. financial capability of RHs, c. democratic culture, values among the RHs,  d. accessibility of RHs in local resources & services. As a result of implemented activities women and girls together with the community challenge GBV, CSO and women network plays active role to linkage with legal service providing institute. Again, women & girls involve in alternative livelihood options; women get economically and socially more empower and control their income and participation in decision making process in family and community level; women have common understanding on climate change and adaptation and they are able to mitigate any kinds of disaster at community level. Local government institutions and different service providing institutes are more democratic and become more responsible to providing their services to the poor women and girls. USS provides necessary supports to perform meeting/workshop with different groups. Training is being provided for gender, domestic law and leadership development. Support is being provided for 3,900 high school and college students. Popular theatre and cultural programs and National /international days is being observed for mass awareness. The project is being implemented in  three Unions of Nilphamari sadar upazila and municipality of Nilphamari district.
This project mainly contributes to results within Combating gender based violence. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
